> 
> Also, what is the hardest thing for mods to do when discussing if a thread should be closed or not?

We look at it and ask ourselves and each other how bad it is, and if it seems like it might be salvaged. Contrary to the accusations we get hit with, we really do not like and do not want to stop people from talking about the things they're interested in. None of us enjoy doing it, but if it's bad and doesn't look like it will get better, we shut it down to avoid having to hit the people in it with infractions.
How do you feel about the way users react to infractions? Are they often annoyed, or feel repentant, etc.?

Never can tell. As a rough estimate, I'd say 30% apologize nicely, 5% flame you, 10% try to argue that you were wrong for issuing the infraction, and the rest just accept it in silence. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
